radiographic_examinations.findings: Clear lungs; cardiac silhouette within normal limits; pacemaker leads well positioned without evidence of lead fracture or cable extrusion.
Normal left ventricular dimensions and wall thickness; normal LV ejection fraction (62%); abnormal apical wall motion reflecting pacemaker activation; elevated right atrial pressure.

Significant variability of myofiber size; disturbed intermyofibrillar network; increase in the number of myofibers with internal nuclei; presence of rimmed vacuoles; eosinophilic material in certain fibers; no active inflammatory changes.
Increased threshold to 2.0 V compared with 0.75 V.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased threshold noted over time indicating potential pacemaker dysfunction.
